communications.communication:

For the multifamily property known as Quimby on 23rd located at 320 23rd Street South Arlington VA 22202 with Parcel ID 34-020-030, please provide the following information:

title: Jefferson Davis Parish Jury List Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act I hereby request the following records:
The following materials regarding the compilation and composition of the state’s master jury list:

All current policies and procedures regarding how the current master jury list was compiled and how often master jury lists are reviewed and updated. Please name all source lists (driver’s license records, voter registration lists, etc) that were utilized in creating the current master jury list.

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the composition of the current master jury list. Please include the total number of individuals on the current master jury list and all relevant demographic data, including but not limited to the race, age and gender of individuals that comprise the current master jury list.

In the event that there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Should the fees exceed $100, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how master jury lists are created. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within the timeframe required by the statute.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all personnel records and files related to complaints, misconduct, and disciplinary actions involving officer Kevin McLaughlin of the Bellingham Police Department.

I am specifically requesting copies of the following documents:

Any formal complaints filed against officer McLaughlin either by members of the public, or by fellow officers or his superiors.

Any internal investigations conducted in response to these complaints or recorded misconduct, including all findings, communications, and conclusions.

Any disciplinary actions taken against officer McLaughlin as a result of these complaints or misconduct, including but not limited to suspension records, reprimands, and training records related to corrective actions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Values Act
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting data and documents related to the California VALUES Act: 

Government Code section 7284.6, subdivision (c)(1) requires California LEAs that participate in a joint law enforcement task force, for which the California LEA has agreed to dedicate personnel or resources on an ongoing basis, to submit a report annually to the DOJ.

I am requesting that data broken down by department and include the required information: (1) the purpose of the task force; (2) the federal, state, and local agencies involved in the task force; (3) the total number of arrests made by the task force during the reporting period; and (4) the total number of arrests made by the task force for immigration enforcement purposes; i.e., any arrests by the task force for any violation of any provisions of the federal Immigration and Nationality Act, which is found in Title 8 of the United States Code.1

Also, include data required by Government Code section 7284.6, subdivision (c)(2) requires all California LEAs (not limited to California LEAs participating in a task force) to report the number of transfers the California LEA makes to immigration authorities in a calendar year, as permitted by Section 7284.6, subdivision (a)(4), and the offense that allowed for the transfer. This information shall also be reported to the DOJ by January 15, 2019, and annually on this date thereafter. 

I understand Annual Reports are created, I am seeking the data used in the reports. 

Include copies of submitted reports from each department, including each Form BCIIS-SB54-1, Form BCIIS-SB54-1A, and Form BCIIS-5854-2. The reports and forms can be released second on a rolling basis. 

Search from 2019 to today's date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Any usage of FTI for AI disclosures sent to the Office of Safeguards 4/1- 4/14

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Any usage of FTI for AI disclosures sent to the Office of Safeguards 4/1- 4/14
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails, memorandum, or other documentation sent to the Office of Safeguards re: the usage of FTI for Artificial Intelligence (AI) purposes by ICE between the dates of 4/1/2025 and 4/14/2025.

Records Source: The MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN U.S. TREASURY DEPARTMENT on behalf of the INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AND U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY on behalf of the U.S. IMMIGRATION AND CUSTOMS ENFORCEMENT, FOR THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION FOR NONTAX CRIMINAL ENFORCEMENT requires the "Usage of FTI for Artificial Intelligence (AI) purposes must be disclosed to the Office of Safeguards for assessment of compliance with safeguard requirements."* 

Time Period: I am requesting any documentation sent in the last two weeks to keep this request narrow and timely. 

Expedited Processing: I request  expedited processing of this request because there is an urgent compelling need to inform the public of the policies and decision-making regarding the ICE analysis of FTI for immigration policy implementation. Politicians on both sides of the aisle have also called attention to excessive use of sensitive data by this administration. For example, on April 9, 18 Senators wrote to the Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (TIGTA) investingdation access to ICE access of taxpayer information.**

* Source: https://files.epi.org/uploads/IRS_ICE_MOU-April-2025.pdf
** Source: https://www.taxnotes.com/research/federal/legislative-documents/congressional-tax-correspondence/senators-seek-investigation-ice-access-taxpayer-info/7rys7

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Williams

title: Right-to-Know Law Request – Arrest of Keith David Cashmere (August 14, 2023 – East Brady Borough)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Right-to-Know Law Request – Arrest of Keith David Cashmere (August 14, 2023 – East Brady Borough)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to public records related to an arrest that occurred on Monday, August 14, 2023, in East Brady Borough, Clarion County, involving Keith David Cashmere.

Incident Summary for Identification:
Date of Incident: August 14, 2023

Time: Approx. 4:28 PM

Location: Purdum Street, East Brady Borough, Clarion County, PA

Suspect: Keith David Cashmere, 36, of East Brady Borough

Agency: Southern Clarion County Regional Police Department

Case Status: Arraigned at 11:58 PM, August 14, 2023, in front of MDJ Jeffrey C. Miller

Charges Filed: Resisting arrest, disorderly conduct (engage in fighting/unreasonable noise)

Summary: Officers attempted to take Cashmere into custody on an involuntary mental health commitment. He resisted physically and verbally, tore out Taser wires twice, and eventually surrendered after further struggle and intervention.

Records Requested:
All body-worn camera footage from officers involved in the arrest of Keith Cashmere.

Any in-car or dashcam video recorded during the incident or transport.

The narrative police report, including the probable cause affidavit and use of force documentation.

Any dispatch logs (CAD records) or 911 call transcripts/audio relevant to the incident.

Any Taser deployment records associated with this arrest.

I request these materials in digital format (email or downloadable link preferred). If any portion of this request is exempt, please provide a written justification citing the specific exemption and release the remaining non-exempt materials.

If the fees for fulfilling this request exceed $25, please inform me beforehand.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request – Officer-Involved Shooting (Dec 26, 2024 – Glenn A. Smock)

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request – Officer-Involved Shooting (Dec 26, 2024 – Glenn A. Smock)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records related to an officer-involved shooting and standoff that occurred on the evening of Thursday, December 26, 2024, involving deputies from the Grant County Sheriff’s Office and a suspect identified as Glenn A. Smock, age 52, of Marion, Indiana.

Incident details for identification:

Date: December 26, 2024

Time: Approx. 6:45–7:00 PM

Location: 3000 block of E County Road 450 N, Marion, IN (near Hart’s Celebration Center, 3031 E 450 N)

Suspect: Glenn A. Smock (52, of Marion)

Involved agency: Grant County Sheriff’s Office

Summary: Deputies responded to reports of a threat. Upon arrival, Smock exited the residence with a shotgun and fired at deputies, striking one. Deputies returned fire and struck Smock, who then barricaded inside the home before surrendering. Both Smock and a deputy sustained injuries. Indiana State Police is the lead investigative agency.

Requested records:

All body-worn camera footage from any deputies involved in this incident.

Any dashcam or vehicle-mounted footage relevant to the response or aerial footage capturing the standoff.

The initial incident report, narrative report, and probable cause affidavit (if filed).

CAD logs and dispatch audio referencing this call and response.

Any radio traffic recordings, 911 call audio, or helicopter support coordination logs, if available.

Any scene photos or footage submitted or recorded by deputies at the scene.

I am requesting these records in digital format, preferably by email or a downloadable link. If any part of this request is exempt under Indiana law, please redact only those parts and provide the remainder, along with a written explanation citing the specific exemption.

If fees exceed $25, I ask that you notify me first before proceeding.

Thank you for your assistance, and I look forward to your response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: CPRA Request – Arrest of Emely Yanagida on August 14, 2024 at Irvine Spectrum Center

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request – Arrest of Emely Yanagida on August 14, 2024 at Irvine Spectrum Center
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

copies of records related to the August 14, 2024 arrest of Emely Yanagida, which occurred at approximately 3:00 PM at the Irvine Spectrum Center.

Incident Summary:
Around 3:00 PM on August 14, 2024, Irvine police responded to a reported theft from Sephora and Lululemon at the Irvine Spectrum Center. The suspect, identified as Emely Yanagida, was reportedly located hiding in the trunk of a white Tesla after fleeing loss prevention officers. Recovered merchandise included approximately $600 worth of products from Sephora and $250 worth of Lululemon items. She was arrested for shoplifting, resisting arrest, and possession of burglary tools.

Records Requested:
All body-worn camera footage from officers involved in the response, search, and arrest of Emely Yanagida

In-car/dashcam footage from patrol vehicles that responded

911 call audio recordings, if applicable, and dispatch logs or CAD reports

Surveillance video obtained from Sephora, Lululemon, or the Irvine Spectrum Center

Arrest reports, narrative summaries, booking sheets, and any probable cause affidavits

Photographs or documentation of the recovered merchandise or burglary tools

Any witness statements or loss prevention reports submitted by retail employees or citizens

If any of these records are withheld or redacted, I request that you cite the specific exemption under the CPRA and provide a justification for the denial.

I am happy to receive responsive records in digital format via email or secure download link. If any fees are anticipated, please notify me in advance of processing.

Thank you for your attention to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Alabama Public Records Request – May 12, 2022 Arrest of Adnen Hannachi (Use of Taser Following Crash)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

copies of all available video and audio records related to the arrest of Adnen Hannachi on or around May 12, 2022, following a multi-car crash on University Boulevard near Cottage Hill Road.

Please include:

All body-worn camera footage from Mobile police officers involved in the arrest and incident

Any dashcam or in-car footage from responding police units

Any bystander or third-party video obtained by officers (if retained)

All dispatch audio, 911 calls, or radio traffic related to the crash response and subsequent arrest

Footage of the Taser deployments and suspect’s resistance during attempted transport to ambulance

Incident Details:

Date & Time: May 12, 2022 (afternoon)

Location: University Boulevard at Cottage Hill Road, Mobile, AL

Arrestee: Adnen Hannachi (27 years old)

Charges:

Three counts of second-degree assault

One count of obstructing justice using a false identity

Summary:

Following a multi-car crash involving four hospitalizations, suspect became combative when EMS attempted to load him into an ambulance

He swung at officers and was tased twice after shouting “I don’t die”

At least one officer, a female, was struck

The incident was partially recorded by a bystander (Kevin Thomas)

Please notify me of any fees in advance. If any portion of the materials is withheld, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemptions relied upon.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Georgia Open Records Act Request – March 12, 2025 Traffic Stop and Officer Dragging Incident (Bryan Myers)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia Open Records Act Request – March 12, 2025 Traffic Stop and Officer Dragging Incident (Bryan Myers)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

copies of all video and audio records related to the March 12, 2025 traffic stop involving Bryan Myers that resulted in a Villa Rica officer being dragged by a vehicle.

Please include:

All dashcam footage, including the full clip showing the officer clinging to the SUV

All body-worn camera footage from Officer V. Hamilton and any backup officers

Any 911 calls, dispatch audio, and radio communications related to the stop, pursuit, or arrest

Footage of the foot pursuit and arrest, including the recovery of a firearm and ecstasy pills

Booking footage or arrest scene video, if available

Incident Details:

Date & Time: March 12, 2025, approximately 2:30 AM

Location: Villa Rica, GA

Officer Involved: Officer V. Hamilton

Suspect: Bryan Myers (49, of Temple, GA)

Summary:

Vehicle stopped for equipment violation

Suspect re-entered SUV, physically resisted, and fled at ~60 MPH with officer partially inside

Officer Hamilton ultimately regained control and stopped the vehicle

Myers fled on foot into nearby woods, dropped a firearm, and was later arrested

Ecstasy pills were recovered from his possession

Charges Filed: Assault on a peace officer, DUI, illegal firearm possession, drug possession, and other related offenses

Please notify me in advance of any associated costs. If any portion of the requested records is withheld, please release all non-exempt material and cite the specific statutory exemption used.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Georgia Open Records Act Request – January 17, 2024 Arrest of Tyree Chapman (Fleeing, Trash Can Arrest)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia Open Records Act Request – January 17, 2024 Arrest of Tyree Chapman (Fleeing, Trash Can Arrest)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

copies of all video and audio recordings related to the arrest of Tyree Chapman on January 17, 2024, by the Atlanta Police Department and associated agencies.

Specifically, I request:

All body-worn camera footage from officers who pursued, located, or arrested Mr. Chapman.

All dashcam/in-car video footage related to this incident.

All video from the Aviation Unit (helicopter footage) showing Chapman’s vehicle, foot pursuit, and arrest.

Any surveillance or third-party footage reviewed or collected by APD.

Any 911 calls, dispatch audio, or radio communications related to the incident.

Identifying Details:

Name of Arrestee: Tyree Chapman

Date: January 17, 2024

Time: Approx. 3:37 PM to 4:00 PM EST (as shown in timestamped bodycam and aviation unit footage)

Initial Location: 300 block of Boulevard NE, Atlanta, GA

Vehicle Involved: Stolen Infiniti Q50 (black)

Pursuit Path: From Chevron gas station to Glenn Street SW and adjoining residential area

Arrest Location: In a trash can in a suburban neighborhood near the 300 block of Glenn Street SW

Charges: Fleeing to elude, reckless driving, firearm possession during felony, theft by receiving, and driving on suspended/revoked license

Notable Footage: Bodycam and aerial footage show Chapman hiding in a trash can; a handgun was found in a separate trash can nearby.

Please inform me of any fees prior to fulfilling this request. If any part of the materials are exempt from release, please provide the non-exempt portions and cite the applicable exemptions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: RE: Atlanta Police Open Records Request
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We located approximately 9 hours of video evidence associated with your request.

We estimate that preparing these videos for release will take approximately 27 hours and three months.

Our cost for processing is $23.31 an hour, with the first 15 minutes free. We estimate that this request will cost $623.54.

title: Flock Safety search audits and data sharing (Largo PD)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Flock Safety search audits and data sharing (Largo, FL)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Search audits and data sharing records related to the agency’s Flock Safety system.

Search audits from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed, including:
- 1. Internal search audits -
Audit logs documenting each time a department account has conducted a search in the department's Flock Safety ALPR system from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Flock Safety calls this an “Organization Audit.”

- 2. External search audits -
Audit logs documenting the searches by users/organizations from outside of the department, that included the department’s Flock Safety ALPR cameras, from 1/1/2024 until the date this request is processed. Flock Safety calls this a “Network Audit.” 

Flock audit logs are retained indefinitely and contain metadata including, but not limited to: the date of the search, the time of the search, the search term/rules, cameras searched, and the user/organization conducting the search. The audit logs are recorded in a database so I ask that you please provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype.


Data sharing settings as of the date this request is processed including:
- 3. Networks that I’m sharing -
The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares its Flock Safety ALPR data, also referred to as "Networks that I’m sharing."

- 4. Flock networks shared with me -
The names of agencies and organizations that have shared their cameras with the Agency, also referred to as "Flock networks shared with me."

The share settings are recorded in a database so I ask that you please provide it to me as a .csv, .xls, or other database filetype.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

A

communications.subject: Montana Freedom of Information Act Request: Montana Jury List Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act I hereby request the following records:
The following materials regarding the compilation and composition of the state’s master jury list:

All current policies and procedures regarding how the current master jury list was compiled and how often master jury lists are reviewed and updated. Please name all source lists (driver’s license records, voter registration lists, etc) that were utilized in creating the current master jury list.

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the composition of the current master jury list. Please include the total number of individuals on the current master jury list and all relevant demographic data, including but not limited to the race, age and gender of individuals that comprise the current master jury list.

In the event that there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Should the fees exceed $100, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how master jury lists are created. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within the timeframe required by the statute.

title: Correspondence between City of Fort Worth and USDA (3.13.25-present) | @fortworthtexas.gov

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Correspondence between City of Fort Worth and USDA (3.13.25-present) | @fortworthtexas.gov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

On March 18, after Secretary Brooke Rollins and the USDA announced widespread cuts to USDA:

https://www.cbsnews.com/news/usda-cancels-local-food-purchasing-food-banks-school-meals/

Fort Worth Mayor Mattie Parker said in a statement to the Fort Worth Star-Telegram that she was “working to communicate directly with the USDA and Secretary Rollins on the short and long-term effects this move will have on our community.”

Read more at: https://www.star-telegram.com/opinion/bradford-william-davis/article302253739.html#storylink=cpy

In a previous FOIA (2025-OSEC-06140-F) I asked USDA to provide any correspondence between the city and offered Mayor Parker's contact info. This time, I am broadening my request.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records,

Correspondence – including calls (phone, Zoom and Microsoft Teams), texts, emails and messages – between the City of Fort Worth, (including Mayor Mattie Parker) and the USDA, (including Sec. of Agriculture Brooke Rollins) between 3/13/2025 and the date this request is received.

Please use the following email domains to assist in your search:
@fortworthtexas.gov
@fortworthgov.org 

Please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage, and therefore we request that you waive any costs.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I also ask that our request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available (email: bdavis@star-telegram) – if not, secure file transfer, thumb drive, or CD-ROM

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bradford

communications.subject: USDA OIA FOIA 2025-OSEC-06268-F Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Dear Bradford William Davis:

This email acknowledges receipt of your attached Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the U.S. Department of Agriculture's (USDA), Office of Information Affairs, FOIA Division (OIA-FOIA). Your request was received by this office on April 11, 2025.

The OIA-FOIA is under the purview of the General Counsel (GC) and serves as the focal point for USDA's FOIA program. It provides coordination and ensures agency-wide compliance with the FOIA.  Additionally, the OIA-FOIA processes requests and appeals on behalf of the Office of the Secretary (OSEC); the Under Secretaries; USDA's staff offices; and the Research, Education and Economics and Trade and Foreign Agricultural Affairs mission areas.

The FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), requires USDA to make a determination in response to a FOIA request within 20 business days from its date of receipt. In unusual circumstances, the Federal agency time limit may be extended by 10 business days as stated in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If your request seeks numerous records that will necessitate a wide-ranging search, including searches with components and possible consultations with components that have a substantial interest in the determination of this request, USDA will invoke a 10 business day extension for determination of your request. You have the option to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records.

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Pursuant to USDA FOIA Regulations, Title 7 CFR §1.6(a), the USDA processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.

Provisions of the FOIA allow USDA to recover part of the cost of complying with your request. For purposes of fee assessment, you have been categorized as a "news media" requester, pursuant to 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1 Section 2(b)(4)(i). For your review and information, a copy of the USDA FOIA Fee Schedule is attached. In accordance with 7 CFR Appendix A to Subpart A of Part 1, Section 3(b), your fees shall be waived where the amount of the fee is $25.00 or less.

You have requested a fee waiver. However, your classification as a news media requester renders your fee waiver request moot because the only fees that would apply to you are duplication costs beyond the first 100 pages. Because your response will be delivered electronically, duplication costs are not anticipated.

A search will be conducted for records responsive to your request. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that a FOIA analyst will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request.

Your request has been assigned FOIA Case No. 2025-OSEC-06268-F. Please refer to this case number in any future correspondence. If you have any questions regarding the processing of this request, please contact Gina Lee at (202) 692-5228 or electronically at Gina.Lee@usda.gov<mailto:Gina.Lee@usda.gov> or USDAFOIA@usda.gov<mailto:USDAFOIA@usda.gov>. For additional information regarding USDA FOIA regulations and process, please refer to the information available on-line at Freedom of Information Act Division | USDA.<https://www.usda.gov/ogc/office-information-affairs/foia-division>

We appreciate the opportunity to assist you.

Sincerely,

Office of Information Affairs

Freedom of Information Act Division




This electronic message contains information generated by the USDA solely for the intended recipients. Any unauthorized interception of this message or the use or disclosure of the information it contains may violate the law and subject the violator to civil or criminal penalties. If you believe you have received this message in error, please notify the sender and delete the email immediately.

communications.subject: Confirmation - P-2025-1244 (City of Federal Way Police Department - Police Records)
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 The City of Federal Way Police Department has received your request Request Number: P-2025-1244 (security key 9B756F57) and we look forward to assisting you with your public records search. 
 This request will be assigned to staff who will begin the process of seeking out responsive documents and determining, based on volume, any costs associated with satisfying your request. Per the Revised Code of Washington (RCW) 42.56.520 you will receive a response within five (5) working days which will be one of the following: 
 Providing the record(s); 
 Providing a link to the records posted on the City website; 
 Providing a reasonable estimate of time the City will require to respond to the request; 
 Seeking clarification of the request; or 
 Denying the request [per RCW 42.56.520(4)]. 
 PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act found in the Revised Code of Washington (RCW) Chapter 42.56 does not require a governmental agency to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you will receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the City of Federal Way Public Records Request Center. 
 Sincerely, 
 Police Records
